text: `[Character A]`, `[Character B]`, `[Character C]`, and `[Character D]` sprint for a single raft—then realize it’s glued to the deck.
`[Character A]` and `[Character B]` flash “Captain’s Keys,” trading empty threats for an hour while onlookers place bets.
`[Character A]`, `[Character B]`, and `[Character C]` get knotted in one hammock; too tangled (and polite) to stab first.
`[Character A]`'s snack is stolen by a gull; `[Character B]`, `[Character C]`, and `[Character D]` draw on the bird, not each other.
`[Character A]` reveals five aces; `[Character B]` reminds everyone they’re using the wrong deck—argument resets nothing.
`[Character A]` and `[Character B]` lead a charge for free spa water, trampling only egos.
`[Character A]` and `[Character B]` broker a truce at the soft-serve machine; everyone double-fists sundaes instead of guns.
`[Character A]` calls “Heel-toe!”; `[Character B]` and `[Character C]` join 40 foes in flawless choreography.
`[Character A]` and `[Character B]` share eight silent floors, guns drawn, nodding politely when Muzak plays “Rawhide.”
`[Character A]` yells “Buffet restocked!”; `[Character B]`, `[Character C]`, and `[Character D]` sprint off, combat paused.
**Costume Mix-up:** `[Character A]` and `[Character B]` show up to the duel wearing identical Hawaiian-fringe poncho outfits, leading to mass confusion and cancelled bets.
**Seasickness Sympathy:** `[Character A]` is about to finish off a seasick `[Character B]`, but suddenly feels a wave of nausea themselves, leading to a mutual, green-faced retreat.

**Fake Shark Fin Scare:** Someone attaches a fake shark fin to a remote-controlled boat in the pool, causing `[Character A]`, `[Character B]`, and `[Character C]` to leap onto the buffet table in panic.

**Lost Luggage Lament:** `[Character A]` and `[Character B]` realize their prized six-shooters were accidentally swapped by the luggage handlers. They spend the round arguing with customer service instead of fighting.
